title: Brownie Crinkle Cookies
description: A crinkle cookie is basically a brownie and cookie hybrid, the ‘crinkle’ part of the name comes from the beautiful shape the cookie creates as it cooks. Dusted with icing sugar, it’s the perfect thing to bake around the festive period. It’s also a one bowl bake which makes it all the more pleasing to make.
method: In a medium sized bowl, mix together the cocoa powder, sugar and oil. Beat in eggs one at a time until fully incorporated. Then mix in the vanilla.
Sift in the flour, baking powder, and salt. Then stir with a wooden spoon until a dough forms. Cover the bowl with clingfilm and refrigerate for at least 4 hours (or overnight).
Preheat the oven to 175C/155C fan. Place the icing sugar into a small bowl.
Line 3 baking trays with baking paper. Roll the dough into tablespoon sized balls.
Roll the dough balls in the icing sugar to generously coat them, then place on the prepared baking tray, leaving ample space between them as they will spread in the oven.
Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes. The cookies spread as they bake, and will come out soft from the oven but will harden up as they cool.
Allow to cool on the baking tray for 5-10 minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.
